credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
title: Sampler
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin, stem, buttonhole and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation
description:
The center field contains an alphabet, a verse, trees and a large house. With a wide floral border on three sides, and an inscription at the bottom.
The verse reads:
Time has Wings and swiftly flies 
Youth and beauty fade away
Virtue is the only prize
Whose sacred joys will ne'er decay

Inscribed: Betsy Adams work wrought in the ninth year of her age
name: Sampler
